title: 103_hr1424
content: The Act titled "Social Security Disability Waiting Period Elimination Act of 1993" eliminates the 5-month waiting period for disability benefits. The Social Security Disability Waiting Period Elimination Act of 1993 removes the waiting period for disability insurance benefits under the Social Security Act. The Social Security Disability Waiting Period Elimination Act of 1993 removes the waiting period for disability insurance benefits under the Social Security Act. Amendments are made to section 223 of the Act, including the elimination of a defined term and conforming amendments to the language used in the Act. The Social Security Disability Waiting Period Elimination Act of 1993 removes the waiting period for disability insurance benefits under the Social Security Act, including amendments to section 223 and the definition of Insured Status. The Social Security Disability Waiting Period Elimination Act of 1993 amends section 223 and widow's insurance benefits based on disability under the Social Security Act. It eliminates the waiting period for disability insurance benefits and revises the criteria for eligibility. The Social Security Disability Waiting Period Elimination Act of 1993 amends section 223 and widower's insurance benefits based on disability under the Social Security Act. It eliminates waiting periods for disability insurance benefits and revises eligibility criteria. The Act also redesignates paragraphs and eliminates defined terms in the Act. The Social Security Disability Waiting Period Elimination Act of 1993 eliminates waiting periods for disability benefits under the Social Security Act. The Social Security Act is amended to eliminate waiting periods for disability benefits. The Social Security Act is amended to remove waiting periods for disability benefits, including changes to Medicare coverage and the Railroad Retirement Act. The Social Security Act is amended to remove waiting periods for disability benefits, including changes to Medicare coverage and the Railroad Retirement Act. Amendments include changing the language regarding entitlement to annuity and removing the requirement of being entitled for 24 months. The effective dates for the amendments to the Social Security Act, including changes to disability benefits, Medicare coverage, and the Railroad Retirement Act, are specified in Section 5. The amendments made by this Act apply to Social Security benefits based on disability and applications for disability determinations filed under title II of the Social Security Act, with specific effective dates outlined in the legislation. The amendments made by this Act apply to insurance benefits under title XVIII of the Social Security Act, with specific effective dates outlined in the legislation.
